<TYPE>EX-99.1
<SEQUENCE>2
<FILENAME>d23980dex991.htm
<DESCRIPTION>EX-99.1

<HTML><HEAD>
<TITLE>EX-99.1</TITLE>
</HEAD>
 <BODY BGCOLOR="WHITE">
<P STYLE="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times 
New Roman" ALIGN="right"><B>Exhibit 99.1 </B></P> <P STYLE="font-
size:18pt;margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt">&nbsp;</P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt" ALIGN="center">
<IMG SRC="g23980g93x29.jpg" ALT="LOGO">
 </P> <P STYLE="margin-top:48pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:12pt; font-
family:Times New Roman" ALIGN="center"><B>SPECIAL MEETING OF SHAREHOLDERS 
</B></P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:12pt; font-family:Times 
New Roman" ALIGN="center"><B>CONCERNING THE ARRANGEMENT INVOLVING </B></P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:12pt; font-family:Times 
New Roman" ALIGN="center"><B>DENISON MINES CORP. AND </B></P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:12pt; font-family:Times 
New Roman" ALIGN="center"><B>FISSION URANIUM CORP. </B></P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times 
New Roman" ALIGN="center"><B>OCTOBER 14, 2015 </B></P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:120pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:12pt; font-family:Times
New Roman" ALIGN="center"><B>NOTICE OF MEETING &amp; </B></P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:12pt; font-family:Times 
New Roman" ALIGN="center"><B>MANAGEMENT INFORMATION CIRCULAR </B></P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times 
New Roman" ALIGN="center"><B>SEPTEMBER 15, 2015 </B></P>
<P STYLE="font-size:36pt;margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt">&nbsp;</P><div 
style="width:100%;margin-left:0%; margin-right:0%;border:solid 1px;padding-
top:2pt;padding-bottom:3pt">
<P STYLE="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:4pt; padding-top:4pt; margin-left:1%; 
margin-right:1%; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman" 
ALIGN="justify">This document is important and requires your immediate 
attention. If you have any questions
as to how to deal with it, you should consult your investment dealer, broker, 
bank manager, lawyer or other professional advisor or the proxy solicitor 
retained by Denison Mines Corp. Boudicca Proxy Consultants, toll free at 1-800-
837-3821 or
outside North America at 416-900-1263 or +44 (0)&nbsp;203 475 3413 or by email 
at <U>denisonmines@boudiccaproxy.com</U>. No securities regulatory authority in 
Canada has expressed an opinion about, or passed upon the fairness or merits of,
the
transactions described in this document, the securities offered pursuant to such
transactions or the adequacy of the information contained in this document and 
it is an offence to claim otherwise. </P></div>
<p Style='page-break-before:always'>
<HR  SIZE="3" style="COLOR:#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">
<P STYLE="margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt">
<IMG SRC="g23980g79n29.jpg" ALT="LOGO">
 </P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-
family:Times New Roman" ALIGN="right">September&nbsp;15, 2015 </P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:18pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times 
New Roman">Dear Shareholder, </P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12pt; margin-bottom:0pt; 
font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman" ALIGN="justify">On behalf of the 
directors
of Denison Mines Corp. (&#147;<B>Denison</B>&#148;), I cordially invite you to 
attend the special meeting (the &#147;<B>Meeting</B>&#148;) of the shareholders 
of Denison (the &#147;<B>Shareholders</B>&#148;) to be held at the offices of 
Cassels
Brock&nbsp;&amp; Blackwell LLP, 40 King Street West, Suite 2100, Toronto, 
Ontario, on October&nbsp;14, 2015 at 10:00 a.m. (Toronto time) to consider 
certain matters relating to the proposed arrangement (the 
&#147;<B>Arrangement</B>&#148;) pursuant
to which Denison proposes to acquire 100% of Fission Uranium Corp. 
(&#147;<B>Fission</B>&#148;) by offering the consideration of 1.26 Denison 
Shares (as defined below) and a cash payment of CAD$0.0001 for each common share
of Fission (a
&#147;<B>Fission Share</B>&#148;) held. We believe that the Arrangement will 
create a diversified uranium company with a significant exploration and 
development portfolio and we anticipate that it will enhance shareholder value. 
</P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:12pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times 
New Roman">At the Meeting, you will be asked to consider and vote on four 
resolutions: </P> <P STYLE="font-size:6pt;margin-top:0pt;margin-
bottom:0pt">&nbsp;</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; font-family:Times New Roman; font-
size:10pt" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="4%" VALIGN="top" ALIGN="left">(i)</TD>
<TD ALIGN="left" VALIGN="top"> <P ALIGN="justify" STYLE="font-family:Times New 
Roman; font-size:10pt">an ordinary resolution authorizing and approving the 
issuance of such number of common shares in the capital of Denison (the 
&#147;<B>Denison
Shares</B>&#148;) as is necessary to allow Denison to acquire 100% of Fission on
the basis of 1.26 Denison Shares on a pre-consolidation basis (or approximately 
0.63 Denison Shares on a post-consolidation basis) for each Fission Share, 
including
Denison Shares issuable upon exercise of stock options or warrants granted by 
Fission to purchase Fission Shares, all pursuant to the Arrangement involving 
Denison and Fission; provided that the maximum number of Denison Shares to be 
issued to
acquire the outstanding Fission Shares shall not be greater than the number of 
Denison Shares issued and outstanding immediately prior to the completion of the
Arrangement, less 100,000, and in such case the exchange ratio shall be adjusted
accordingly (the &#147;<B>Share Issuance Resolution</B>&#148;); 
</P></TD></TR></TABLE> <P STYLE="font-size:6pt;margin-top:0pt;margin-
bottom:0pt">&nbsp;</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; font-family:Times New Roman; font-
size:10pt" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="4%" VALIGN="top" ALIGN="left">(ii)</TD>
<TD ALIGN="left" VALIGN="top"> <P ALIGN="justify" STYLE="font-family:Times New 
Roman; font-size:10pt">a special resolution authorizing and approving a 
consolidation of the issued and outstanding Denison Shares on a 2-for-1 basis 
(the
&#147;<B>Consolidation Resolution</B>&#148;); </P></TD></TR></TABLE> <P 
STYLE="font-size:6pt;margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt">&nbsp;</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; font-family:Times New Roman; font-
size:10pt" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="4%" VALIGN="top" ALIGN="left">(iii)</TD>
<TD ALIGN="left" VALIGN="top"> <P ALIGN="justify" STYLE="font-family:Times New 
Roman; font-size:10pt">a special resolution authorizing and approving a name 
change of Denison to &#147;Denison Energy Corp.&#148; or such other name as is 
determined by
the board of directors of Denison (the &#147;<B>Board</B>&#148;) in its 
discretion, subject to regulatory approval (the &#147;<B>Name Change 
Resolution</B>&#148;); and </P></TD></TR></TABLE>
<P STYLE="font-size:6pt;margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt">&nbsp;</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; font-family:Times New Roman; font-
size:10pt" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="4%" VALIGN="top" ALIGN="left">(iv)</TD>
<TD ALIGN="left" VALIGN="top"> <P ALIGN="justify" STYLE="font-family:Times New 
Roman; font-size:10pt">an ordinary resolution authorizing and approving the 
issuance of such number of Denison Shares as is necessary to allow Denison to 
make the
retention bonus payments to each of Messrs Randhawa, McElroy, Hochstein, Cates 
(at the election of Mr.&nbsp;Cates), Charlish (at the election of 
Mr.&nbsp;Charlish) and other employees of Denison (allocated at the discretion
of Denison), equal to an
aggregate amount of CAD$4,596,041, which Denison Shares will be valued at the 
five (5)&nbsp;day volume weighted average price of the Denison Shares on the 
Toronto Stock Exchange (the &#147;<B>TSX</B>&#148;) on a post-consolidation 
basis, immediately
following the date on which the Arrangement becomes effective (the 
&#147;<B>Retention Bonus Resolution</B>&#148;). </P></TD></TR></TABLE> <P 
STYLE="margin-top:12pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New
Roman" ALIGN="justify">The
Arrangement is conditional on the approval by Shareholders of the Share Issuance
Resolution and the approval by Fission Shareholders of the Arrangement. </P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:18pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times 
New Roman"><B>How the Arrangement is expected to benefit Shareholders </B></P> 
<P STYLE="font-size:6pt;margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt">&nbsp;</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; font-family:Times New Roman; font-
size:10pt" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="1%">&nbsp;</TD>
<TD WIDTH="2%" VALIGN="top" ALIGN="left">&#149;</TD>
<TD WIDTH="1%" VALIGN="top">&nbsp;</TD>
<TD ALIGN="left" VALIGN="top"> <P ALIGN="justify" STYLE="font-family:Times New 
Roman; font-size:10pt"><I>Consolidation of Strategic Uranium Assets:</I> 
Consolidation of a portfolio of strategic uranium asset interests in the 
Athabasca Basin,
highlighted by Fission&#146;s 100% owned Patterson Lake South Property and 
Denison&#146;s 60% owned Wheeler River Project. Significant additional assets 
include Denison&#146;s interests in the McClean Lake Mill and the Midwest, 
McClean Lake,
Waterbury Lake, Mann Lake, and Wolly projects. With Patterson Lake South and 
Wheeler River as cornerstone projects, the Combined Company will have a fully 
integrated platform of exploration, resource development, advanced development, 
and revenue
producing assets. Shareholders of the Combined Company will hold interests in 
five of the ten largest undeveloped projects in the Athabasca Basin, as measured
by contained uranium. </P></TD></TR></TABLE>
<p Style='page-break-before:always'>
<HR  SIZE="3" style="COLOR:#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; font-family:Times New Roman; font-
size:10pt" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="1%">&nbsp;</TD>
<TD WIDTH="2%" VALIGN="top" ALIGN="left">&#149;</TD>
<TD WIDTH="1%" VALIGN="top">&nbsp;</TD>
<TD ALIGN="left" VALIGN="top"> <P ALIGN="justify" STYLE="font-family:Times New 
Roman; font-size:10pt"><I>Enhanced Leverage to Athabasca Basin Resources</I>: 
The acquisition of the Patterson Lake South Property will substantially increase
Denison&#146;s total resource base. The combined portfolio would better position
Denison for potential future appreciation in the price of uranium. 
</P></TD></TR></TABLE> <P STYLE="font-size:6pt;margin-top:0pt;margin-
bottom:0pt">&nbsp;</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; font-family:Times New Roman; font-
size:10pt" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="1%">&nbsp;</TD>
<TD WIDTH="2%" VALIGN="top" ALIGN="left">&#149;</TD>
<TD WIDTH="1%" VALIGN="top">&nbsp;</TD>
<TD ALIGN="left" VALIGN="top"> <P ALIGN="justify" STYLE="font-family:Times New 
Roman; font-size:10pt"><I>Ownership of the Cornerstone Asset in a Potential New 
Mining District: </I>Fission&#146;s 100% owned Patterson Lake South Property 
hosts the
largest undeveloped resource in an emerging uranium exploration and development
region, the Western Athabasca Basin. </P></TD></TR></TABLE> <P STYLE="font-
size:6pt;margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt">&nbsp;</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; font-family:Times New Roman; font-
size:10pt" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="1%">&nbsp;</TD>
<TD WIDTH="2%" VALIGN="top" ALIGN="left">&#149;</TD>
<TD WIDTH="1%" VALIGN="top">&nbsp;</TD>
<TD ALIGN="left" VALIGN="top"> <P ALIGN="justify" STYLE="font-family:Times New 
Roman; font-size:10pt"><I>Continued Exploration Potential:</I> Establishment of 
an exploration foothold in both the Eastern Athabasca Basin and the Western 
Athabasca
Basin, with a combined land package of over 430,000 hectares and a sizeable base
of mineral resources defined under National Instrument 43-101, is expected to 
provide the foundation for future resource growth. </P></TD></TR></TABLE>
<P STYLE="font-size:6pt;margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt">&nbsp;</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; font-family:Times New Roman; font-
size:10pt" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="1%">&nbsp;</TD>
<TD WIDTH="2%" VALIGN="top" ALIGN="left">&#149;</TD>
<TD WIDTH="1%" VALIGN="top">&nbsp;</TD>
<TD ALIGN="left" VALIGN="top"> <P ALIGN="justify" STYLE="font-family:Times New 
Roman; font-size:10pt"><I>Complimentary Combined Management Team: </I>Management
from Fission and Denison will be combined. Following the closing of the 
Arrangement, the
board of the Combined Company will be reconstituted to consist of ten 
(10)&nbsp;directors, five (5)&nbsp;of whom will be Denison nominees (which will 
include one (1)&nbsp;nominee of Korea Electric Power Corporation and KEPCO 
Canada Uranium
Investment Limited Partnership, a significant shareholder of Denison), and five 
(5)&nbsp;of whom will be Fission nominees. This combination offers expertise and
complementary skill-sets at both the board and management level, drawing on 
extensive
strategic, operating, exploration, development and financial experience. 
</P></TD></TR></TABLE> <P STYLE="font-size:6pt;margin-top:0pt;margin-
bottom:0pt">&nbsp;</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; font-family:Times New Roman; font-
size:10pt" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="1%">&nbsp;</TD>
<TD WIDTH="2%" VALIGN="top" ALIGN="left">&#149;</TD>
<TD WIDTH="1%" VALIGN="top">&nbsp;</TD>
<TD ALIGN="left" VALIGN="top"> <P ALIGN="justify" STYLE="font-family:Times New 
Roman; font-size:10pt"><I>Enhanced Capital Markets Profile:</I> The Combined 
Company is expected to be the largest publicly traded exploration and 
development uranium
company in the world by market capitalization. Denison and Fission believe that 
this will lead to increased trading liquidity, analyst coverage, index inclusion
and global capital markets profile. </P></TD></TR></TABLE>
<P STYLE="margin-top:12pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times 
New Roman" ALIGN="justify">After considering, among other things, an opinion 
from its financial advisor, Haywood Securities Inc. 
(&#147;<B>Haywood</B>&#148;), that the
Arrangement is fair, from a financial point of view, to Denison and its 
Shareholders, the Board has unanimously determined that the offered 
consideration is fair from a financial point of view to Shareholders and that 
the Arrangement is in the best
interests of Denison. Following the completion of the Arrangement, Shareholders 
will hold approximately 51.6% of the Combined Company, and current Fission 
shareholders will hold approximately 48.4%. </P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:12pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times 
New Roman"><B>THE BOARD OF DENISON UNANIMOUSLY SUPPORTS THE ARRANGEMENT AND 
RECOMMENDS THAT SHAREHOLDERS VOTE <U>FOR</U> ALL THE RESOLUTIONS. </B></P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:12pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times 
New Roman" ALIGN="justify"><B>Each of the directors and a majority of the senior
officers of Denison intend to vote his or her Denison Shares FOR the approval of
the
four resolutions.</B> Such directors and senior officers of Denison, 
beneficially own, directly or indirectly, 2,835,596 Denison Shares, representing
approximately 0.5% of the issued and outstanding Denison Shares as of 
September&nbsp;4, 2015, being
the record date for the Meeting. Notwithstanding the foregoing, for purposes of 
good corporate governance, Messrs. Cates and Hochstein have indicated their 
intention to abstain from voting on the Retention Bonus Resolution. </P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:12pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times 
New Roman" ALIGN="justify"><B></B>We hope you will be able to attend the 
Meeting. Whether or not you are able to attend, it is important that you be 
represented at the
Meeting. We encourage you to complete the enclosed form of proxy (the 
&#147;<B>Proxy</B>&#148;) and return it, by the time specified in the notice of 
the Meeting and the management information circular (the 
&#147;<B>Circular</B>&#148;), to
Computershare Investor Services Inc. (&#147;<B>Computershare</B>&#148;) at the 
address specified on the Proxy. Voting by Proxy will not prevent you from voting
in person if you attend the Meeting, but will ensure that your vote will be 
counted if
you are unable to attend. <B> </B></P>
<p Style='page-break-before:always'>
<HR  SIZE="3" style="COLOR:#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">
<P STYLE="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times 
New Roman" ALIGN="justify">Your vote is important regardless of the number of 
Denison Shares that you own. If you are a
registered Shareholder, and are unable to be present in person at the Meeting, 
we encourage you to vote by completing the enclosed Proxy. If you are a non-
registered holder of Denison Shares and have received this letter and the 
Circular from your
broker or another intermediary, please complete and return the voting 
instruction form or Proxy provided to you by your broker or other intermediary 
in accordance with the instructions provided with it. Failure to do so may 
result in your Denison
Shares not being eligible to be voted at the Meeting. </P> <P STYLE="margin-
top:12pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman" 
ALIGN="justify">Included with this letter, is a notice of the Meeting and the 
Circular. The
Circular contains a detailed description of the Arrangement, including the 
arrangement agreement between Denison and Fission governing the terms of the 
Arrangement. You should carefully consider all of the information in, and 
incorporated by
reference in, the Circular. </P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12pt; margin-bottom:0pt; 
font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman" ALIGN="justify">For registered 
Shareholders, also included with this letter is a letter of transmittal. If you 
are a
registered Shareholder we also encourage you to complete and return the enclosed
letter of transmittal together with the certificate(s) representing your Denison
Shares and any other required documents and instruments, to the depositary,
Computershare, in the enclosed return envelope in accordance with the 
instructions set out in the letter of transmittal. If the Arrangement is 
approved, this will enable the post-consolidation Denison Shares to be sent to 
you as soon as possible
after the Arrangement becomes effective. The letter of transmittal contains 
other procedural information related to the Arrangement and should be reviewed 
carefully. If you hold your Denison Shares through a broker or other 
intermediary you are not
required to submit a letter of transmittal. Instead, please contact that broker 
or other intermediary for instructions and assistance in receiving your post-
consolidation Denison Shares. </P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:12pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times 
New Roman" ALIGN="justify"><B>If you have any questions or require more 
information with regard to voting your Denison Shares, please contact 
Computershare by telephone
at 1-800-564-6253 or by email to </B><U>service@computershare.com</U><B> or the 
proxy solicitation agent retained by Denison, Boudicca Proxy Consultants, toll 
free at 1-800-837-3821 or outside North America at 416-900-1263 or
+44&nbsp;(0)203&nbsp;475&nbsp;3413 or by email at 
</B><U>denisonmines@boudiccaproxy.com</U>.<B> </B></P> <P STYLE="margin-
top:12pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman" 
ALIGN="justify">On behalf of Denison, I would like to
thank you for your continued support as we proceed with this important and 
strategic transaction. </P> <P STYLE="margin-top:18pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-
size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman">Sincerely, </P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:12pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times 
New Roman"><I></I>(signed) <I>&#147;Ron F. Hochstein&#148; </I></P> <P 
STYLE="margin-top:12pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New
Roman">Ron F.
Hochstein </P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; 
font-family:Times New Roman">Executive Chairman </P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0pt; 
margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman">Denison Mines 
Corp. </P>
<p Style='page-break-before:always'>
<HR  SIZE="3" style="COLOR:#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">
<P STYLE="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times 
New Roman" ALIGN="center"><B>FREQUENTLY ASKED QUESTIONS ABOUT THE ARRANGEMENT 
AND THE DENISON MEETING </B></P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:12pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times 
New Roman" ALIGN="justify"><I>The following are some questions that you, as a 
Shareholder, may have relating to the Meeting and answers to those questions. 
These
questions and answers do not provide all of the information relating to the 
Meeting or the matters to be considered at the Meeting and are qualified in 
their entirety by the more detailed information contained elsewhere in this 
Circular. You are
urged to read this Circular in its entirety before making a decision related to 
your Denison Shares. All capitalized terms used herein have the meanings 
ascribed to them in the &#147;Glossary&#148; of the Circular. </I></P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:12pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times 
New Roman"><B>Q: What am I voting on? </B></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12pt; 
margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman" 
ALIGN="justify">A: You are
being asked to consider and, if deemed advisable, to vote <U>FOR</U> each of the
Share Issuance Resolution, the Consolidation Resolution, the Name Change 
Resolution and the Retention Bonus Resolution (together the &#147;<B>Denison
Resolutions</B>&#148;). </P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-
size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman" ALIGN="justify">The Share Issuance 
Resolution is an ordinary resolution authorizing and approving Denison to issue 
such number of
Denison Shares as is necessary to allow Denison to acquire 100% of Fission on 
the basis of 1.26 Denison Shares on a pre-Consolidation basis (approximately 
0.63 New Denison Shares on a post-Consolidation basis) for each Fission Share; 
provided that
the maximum number of Denison Shares to be issued shall not be greater than the 
number of Denison Shares issued and outstanding immediately prior to the 
completion of the Arrangement, less 100,000 (the &#147;<B>Consideration Share
Maximum</B>&#148;), and in such case the Exchange Ratio shall be adjusted so 
that the total number of Denison Shares issued does not exceed the Consideration
Share Maximum. In addition, as part of the consideration, a cash payment will be
made of
CAD$0.0001, for each Fission Share held. </P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12pt; margin-
bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman" 
ALIGN="justify"><B></B>The Consolidation Resolution is a special resolution 
authorizing and approving an
amendment to Denison&#146;s articles of amalgamation (the &#147;<B>Denison 
Articles</B>&#148;) to effect a consolidation of the issued and outstanding 
Denison Shares on a 2-for-1 basis.<B> </B></P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:12pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times 
New Roman" ALIGN="justify">The Name Change Resolution is a special resolution 
authorizing and approving an amendment to Denison&#146;s Articles to effect the 
name change
of Denison to &#147;Denison Energy Corp.&#148; or such other name as is 
determined by the Board in its sole discretion, subject to regulatory approval. 
</P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:12pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times 
New Roman" ALIGN="justify">The Retention Bonus Resolution is an ordinary 
resolution authorizing and approving Denison to issue such number of Denison 
Shares as is
necessary to make the Retention Bonus Payments to each of Messrs Randhawa, 
McElroy, Hochstein, Cates (at the election of Mr.&nbsp;Cates), Charlish (at the 
election of Mr.&nbsp;Charlish) and other employees of Denison (allocated at the 
discretion of
Denison). </P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; 
font-family:Times New Roman">See &#147;Special Business to be Considered at the 
Meeting&#148; in this Circular. </P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:12pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times 
New Roman"><B>Q: Why Should I Vote FOR the Denison Resolutions? </B></P> <P 
STYLE="margin-top:12pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New
Roman">A:
The Arrangement is expected to provide a number of benefits to Shareholders 
including: </P> <P STYLE="font-size:6pt;margin-top:0pt;margin-
bottom:0pt">&nbsp;</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; font-family:Times New Roman; font-
size:10pt" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="1%">&nbsp;</TD>
<TD WIDTH="2%" VALIGN="top" ALIGN="left">&#149;</TD>
<TD WIDTH="1%" VALIGN="top">&nbsp;</TD>
<TD ALIGN="left" VALIGN="top"> <P ALIGN="justify" STYLE="font-family:Times New 
Roman; font-size:10pt">the consolidation of strategic uranium assets 
</P></TD></TR></TABLE> <P STYLE="font-size:6pt;margin-top:0pt;margin-
bottom:0pt">&nbsp;</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; font-family:Times New Roman; font-
size:10pt" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="1%">&nbsp;</TD>
<TD WIDTH="2%" VALIGN="top" ALIGN="left">&#149;</TD>
<TD WIDTH="1%" VALIGN="top">&nbsp;</TD>
<TD ALIGN="left" VALIGN="top"> <P ALIGN="justify" STYLE="font-family:Times New 
Roman; font-size:10pt">the combined portfolio would better position Denison for 
potential future appreciation in the price of uranium </P></TD></TR></TABLE>
<P STYLE="font-size:6pt;margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt">&nbsp;</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; font-family:Times New Roman; font-
size:10pt" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>

Roman; font-size:10pt">ownership of a cornerstone asset in a potential new 
mining district </P></TD></TR></TABLE>
<P STYLE="font-size:6pt;margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt">&nbsp;</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; font-family:Times New Roman; font-

Roman; font-size:10pt">continued exploration potential </P></TD></TR></TABLE> <P
STYLE="font-size:6pt;margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt">&nbsp;</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; font-family:Times New Roman; font-
size:10pt" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">

<TD WIDTH="1%" VALIGN="top">&nbsp;</TD>

</P></TD></TR></TABLE> <P STYLE="font-size:6pt;margin-top:0pt;margin-

</P></TD></TR></TABLE>
<P STYLE="margin-top:12pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times 
New Roman"><I></I>See &#147;The Arrangement <I>&#150;</I> Reasons and Benefits 
of the Arrangement&#148; in this Circular.<I> </I></P>
 <p STYLE="margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt ; font-size:8pt">&nbsp;</P> <P 
STYLE="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New 
Roman" ALIGN="center">i </P>
<p Style='page-break-before:always'>
<HR  SIZE="3" style="COLOR:#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">
<P STYLE="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times 
New Roman"><B>Q: Will the Denison Shares granted to Fission Shareholders be 
Consolidated? </B></P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:12pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times 
New Roman" ALIGN="justify">A: Yes. Once Fission Shareholders receive their 
Denison Shares they will also participate in the Consolidation. Fission 
Shareholders will
receive 1.26 Denison Shares on a pre-Consolidation basis (approximately 0.63 New
Denison Shares on a post-Consolidation basis) for each Fission Share held. </P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:12pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times 
New Roman"><B>Q: Why are we being asked to vote on the issuance of the Retention
Bonus Shares? </B></P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:12pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times 
New Roman" ALIGN="justify">A: The TSX has advised that they are treating the 
issuance of the Denison Shares in satisfaction of certain of the Retention Bonus
Payments as
&#147;security based compensation arrangements&#148; requiring shareholder 
approval. </P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; 
font-family:Times New Roman"><B>Q: Are all Retention Bonus Shares subject to 
Shareholder
approval? </B></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt;
font-family:Times New Roman" ALIGN="justify">A: Yes. It should also be noted 
that there is an additional CAD$1,000,000 in aggregate in Denison Shares that 
are issuable
to Fission employees (at the discretion of Fission) who will become employees 
(but not insiders) of Denison after the Arrangement, which the TSX has advised 
is <U>not</U> subject to Shareholder approval, and therefore these Denison 
Shares are not
included in the definition of &#147;Retention Bonus Shares&#148; throughout the 
Circular. Additionally, each of Mr.&nbsp;Cates (with a Retention Bonus Payment 
of CAD$425,780) and Mr.&nbsp;Charlish (with a Retention Bonus Payment of 
CAD$215,061) has
the option of receiving a cash payment in satisfaction of their Retention Bonus 
Payment. </P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; 
font-family:Times New Roman"><B>Q: What is the aggregate amount of Retention 
Bonus Payments
that could be payable as a result of the Arrangement? </B></P> <P STYLE="margin-
top:12pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman" 
ALIGN="justify">A: CAD$5,596,041 in aggregate. Of the foregoing amount an 
aggregate of
CAD$4,955,200 (which includes the CAD$1,000,000 payable through the issuance of 
Denison Shares to Fission employees, but which is <U>not</U> subject to 
Shareholder approval) is payable only through the issuance of Denison Shares and
CAD$640,841 may
be paid through cash or the issuance of Retention Bonus Shares. </P> <P 
STYLE="margin-top:12pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New
Roman" ALIGN="justify"><B>Q: Will Retention Bonus Payments be paid in cash by 
the Combined
Company in the event the Shareholders do not vote in favour of the Retention 
Bonus Resolution? </B></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-
size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman" ALIGN="justify">A: In the event the 
Retention Bonus
Resolution is not passed by the Shareholders at the Meeting, it is intended that
all Retention Bonus Payments discussed in this Circular will be made in such 
manner as determined by the compensation committee of the Combined Company. The 
Retention
Bonus Payments will likely be paid in cash or a combination of cash and options.
</P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-
family:Times New Roman" ALIGN="justify">See &#147;The Arrangement &#150; 
Employment
Matters&#148; and &#147;The Arrangement &#150; Risk Factor Following Completion 
of the Arrangement&#148; in this Circular. </P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12pt; 
margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman"><B>Q: Why does 
each of Fission
and Denison want to issue shares in satisfaction of the Retention Bonus 
Payments? </B></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt;
font-family:Times New Roman" ALIGN="justify">A: In light of current and 
prevailing market
conditions, and in order to preserve cash in the treasury of the Combined 
Company, each of Fission and Denison believe that it is in the best interests of
the Combined Company to issue Denison Shares to meet these obligations and use 
available cash
to advance the projects of the Combined Company. </P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12pt;
margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman" 
ALIGN="justify"><B>Q: What percentage of the issued and outstanding shares of 
Denison does the issuance
of the Retention Bonus Shares represent? </B></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12pt; 
margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman" 
ALIGN="justify">A: Any Denison Shares that are issued as a Retention Bonus 
Payment will be valued at the
five (5)&nbsp;day volume weighted average price (&#147;<B>VWAP</B>&#148;) of the
Denison Shares on the TSX (on a post-Consolidation basis), immediately following
the Effective Date. It is unknown what percentage this will represent at the 
Effective
Time however, based on the five (5)&nbsp;day VWAP on the Record Date, the 
aggregate of all Retention Bonus Shares payable will represent 1.69% of the 
issued and outstanding Denison Shares before giving effect to the Arrangement 
and 0.87% of the
issued and outstanding Denison Shares after giving effect to the Arrangement. 
</P>
 <p STYLE="margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt ; font-size:8pt">&nbsp;</P> <P 
STYLE="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New
Roman" ALIGN="center">ii </P>
<p Style='page-break-before:always'>
<HR  SIZE="3" style="COLOR:#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">
<P STYLE="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times 
New Roman"><B>Q: What is the Recommendation of the Board? </B></P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:12pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times 
New Roman" ALIGN="justify">A: The Board has unanimously approved the Arrangement
Agreement and the terms of the Arrangement and unanimously recommends that the
Shareholders vote <U>FOR</U> each of the Denison Resolutions at the Meeting. 
</P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-
family:Times New Roman" ALIGN="justify">In recommending that the Shareholders 
vote <U>FOR</U> the
Denison Resolutions, the Board considered, among other things, the expected 
benefits of the Arrangement, the fairness opinion provided by Denison&#146;s 
financial advisor, Haywood, and current industry, economic and market 
conditions. The Board has
determined that the Consideration is fair from a financial point of view to 
Shareholders and that the Arrangement is in the best interests of Denison. </P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:12pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times 
New Roman">See &#147;The Arrangement <I>&#150;</I> Recommendation of the 
Board&#148; in this Circular. </P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:12pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times 
New Roman"><B>Q: When and where is the Meeting? </B></P> <P STYLE="margin-
top:12pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman" 
ALIGN="justify">A:
The Meeting will take place on October&nbsp;14, 2015 at 10:00 a.m. (Toronto 
time), at the offices of Cassels Brock&nbsp;&amp; Blackwell LLP, 40&nbsp;King 
Street West, Suite 2100, Toronto, Ontario. </P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:12pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times 
New Roman"><B>Q: Who can attend and vote at the Meeting and what is the quorum 
for the Meeting? </B></P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:12pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times 
New Roman" ALIGN="justify">A: Only Shareholders of record as of the close of 
business on September&nbsp;4, 2015, the record date for the Meeting (the 
&#147;<B>Record
Date</B>&#148;), are entitled to receive notice of and to attend, and vote at, 
the Meeting or any adjournment(s) or postponement(s) of the Meeting. The 
presence, in person or by proxy, of two Shareholders entitled to vote thereat, 
holding in the
aggregate not less than 10% of the issued and outstanding Denison Shares, will 
constitute a quorum for the Meeting. </P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12pt; margin-
bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman"><B>Q: How many Denison 
Shares are
entitled to vote? </B></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-
size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman" ALIGN="justify">A: At the close of 
business on the Record Date there were 518,438,669 Denison Shares outstanding, 
all of which are
entitled to be voted at the Meeting. </P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12pt; margin-
bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman"><B>Q: What vote is 
required at the Meeting to approve the Denison Resolutions? </B></P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:12pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times 
New Roman" ALIGN="justify">A: The Share Issuance Resolution and the Retention 
Bonus Resolution each require the approval of a majority of the votes cast. The
Consolidation Resolution and the Name Change Resolution each require the 
approval of two-thirds (66<SUP STYLE="vertical-
align:top">&nbsp;2</SUP>&#8260;<SUB STYLE="vertical-align:bottom">3</SUB>
%)&nbsp;of the votes cast. </P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:12pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times 
New Roman"><B>Q: How do I vote? </B></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12pt; margin-
bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman">A: Registered 
Shareholders can vote
in the following ways: </P> <P STYLE="font-size:6pt;margin-top:0pt;margin-
bottom:0pt">&nbsp;</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; font-family:Times New Roman; font-
size:10pt" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="5%">&nbsp;</TD>
<TD WIDTH="2%" VALIGN="top" ALIGN="left">&#149;</TD>
<TD WIDTH="1%" VALIGN="top">&nbsp;</TD>
<TD ALIGN="left" VALIGN="top"> <P ALIGN="justify" STYLE="font-family:Times New 
Roman; font-size:10pt"><B>Mail</B>: To the offices of Computershare Investor 
Services Inc., Toronto, Office, Proxy Department, 100 University Avenue, 8th 
Floor, Toronto,
Ontario, Canada M5J 2Y1; or </P></TD></TR></TABLE> <P STYLE="font-
size:6pt;margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt">&nbsp;</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; font-family:Times New Roman; font-
size:10pt" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="5%">&nbsp;</TD>
<TD WIDTH="2%" VALIGN="top" ALIGN="left">&#149;</TD>
<TD WIDTH="1%" VALIGN="top">&nbsp;</TD>
<TD ALIGN="left" VALIGN="top"> <P ALIGN="justify" STYLE="font-family:Times New 
Roman; font-size:10pt"><B>Telephone</B>: Call the toll-free number indicated on 
the proxy form (1-866-732-VOTE (8683))&nbsp;and follow the prompts; or
</P></TD></TR></TABLE> <P STYLE="font-size:6pt;margin-top:0pt;margin-
bottom:0pt">&nbsp;</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; font-family:Times New Roman; font-
size:10pt" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="5%">&nbsp;</TD>
<TD WIDTH="2%" VALIGN="top" ALIGN="left">&#149;</TD>
<TD WIDTH="1%" VALIGN="top">&nbsp;</TD>
<TD ALIGN="left" VALIGN="top"> <P ALIGN="justify" STYLE="font-family:Times New 
Roman; font-size:10pt"><B>Online</B>: Go to the website indicated on the proxy 
form (<U>www.investorvote.com</U>) and follow the instructions on the screen; or
</P></TD></TR></TABLE> <P STYLE="font-size:6pt;margin-top:0pt;margin-
bottom:0pt">&nbsp;</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; font-family:Times New Roman; font-
size:10pt" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="5%">&nbsp;</TD>
<TD WIDTH="2%" VALIGN="top" ALIGN="left">&#149;</TD>
<TD WIDTH="1%" VALIGN="top">&nbsp;</TD>
<TD ALIGN="left" VALIGN="top"> <P ALIGN="justify" STYLE="font-family:Times New 
Roman; font-size:10pt"><B>In Person</B>: Present yourself to a representative of
Computershare at the Meeting. </P></TD></TR></TABLE>
<P STYLE="margin-top:12pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times 
New Roman" ALIGN="justify">Non-Registered Shareholders typically receive a 
voting instruction form (&#147;<B>VIF</B>&#148;); however they may also receive 
a Proxy. In
order to vote, it is important that you comply strictly with the instructions 
that have been given to you on your VIF or Proxy. </P>
 <p STYLE="margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt ; font-size:8pt">&nbsp;</P> <P 
STYLE="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New 
Roman" ALIGN="center">iii </P>
<p Style='page-break-before:always'>
<HR  SIZE="3" style="COLOR:#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">
<P STYLE="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times 
New Roman"><B>Q: What if I return my Proxy but do not mark it to show how I wish
to vote? </B></P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:12pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times 
New Roman" ALIGN="justify">A: If your Proxy is signed and dated and returned
without specifying your choice or is returned specifying both choices, your 
Denison Shares
will be voted <U>FOR</U> each of the Share Issuance Resolution, the 
Consolidation Resolution, the Name Change Resolution and the Retention Bonus 
Resolution in accordance with the recommendations of the Board. </P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:12pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times 
New Roman"><B>Q: When is the cut-off time for delivery of Proxies? </B></P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:12pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times 
New Roman" ALIGN="justify">A: Proxies must be received not less than 48 hours 
(excluding Saturdays, Sundays and holidays) before the time of the Meeting or 
any
adjournment thereof. In this case, assuming no adjournment, the proxy-cut off 
time is 10:00 a.m. (Toronto time) on October&nbsp;9, 2015. The Chairman of the 
Meeting may waive the Proxy cut-off time at his discretion without notice. </P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:12pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times 
New Roman"><B>Q: Can I change my vote? </B></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12pt; 
margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman" 
ALIGN="justify">A: A
Registered Shareholder who has submitted a Proxy may revoke it by: 
(a)&nbsp;delivering a written notice signed by the Registered Shareholder or by 
an attorney authorized in writing or, if the Registered Shareholder is a 
corporation, by a duly
authorized officer or attorney, (i)&nbsp;at the registered office of Denison to 
the Corporate Secretary, Denison Mines Corp., 40 University Ave, Suite 1100, 
Toronto, Ontario, Canada M5J 1T1, not less than 48 hours (excluding Saturdays, 
Sundays and
holidays) before the time of the Meeting, or (ii)&nbsp;to the Chairman of the 
Meeting prior to the commencement of the Meeting on the day of the Meeting; 
(b)&nbsp;completing and signing a Proxy bearing a later date and depositing it 
with
Computershare not less than 48 hours (excluding Saturdays, Sundays and holidays)
before the time of the Meeting; or (c)&nbsp;in any other manner permitted by 
law. </P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:12pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times 
New Roman" ALIGN="justify">Non-Registered Shareholders who have submitted a VIF 
or Proxy should contact their Intermediaries and their service companies 
regarding how to
change their vote. </P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-
size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman" ALIGN="justify"><B>Q: Do any directors 
or executive officers of Denison have any interests in the Arrangement that are 
different from,
or in addition to, those of the Shareholders? </B></P> <P STYLE="margin-
top:12pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman" 
ALIGN="justify">A: Certain directors and/or executive officers of Denison have 
interests in the
Arrangement that are different than the interests of Shareholders generally. 
These interests relate to the fact that certain directors or officers may 
continue to serve as directors or officers of Denison following completion of 
the Arrangement, and
that a certain director and an officer will receive Retention Bonus Payments as 
set forth in the Arrangement Agreement following the completion of the 
Arrangement, subject to Shareholder approval of the Retention Bonus Resolution. 
In addition, all
unvested Denison Options held by resigning Denison directors and officers who 
are not continuing on with the Combined Company will vest on the Effective Date 
and all unexpired options will be exercisable until the later of 
December&nbsp;31, 2015 and
the date on which they would expire or terminate in accordance with the terms of
the Denison Option Plan. </P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12pt; margin-bottom:0pt; 
font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman"><B>Q: What other conditions must be
satisfied
to complete the Arrangement? </B></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12pt; margin-
bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman" ALIGN="justify">A: In 
addition to the approval of the Share Issuance Resolution by the Shareholders,
the Arrangement is
also conditional upon, among other things, the approval of Fission Shareholders 
regarding the Arrangement, Court approval of the Arrangement, the performance by
each of Fission and Denison of all obligations under the Arrangement Agreement 
and the
receipt of all applicable approvals, including the Competition Act Approval, all
in accordance with the terms of the Arrangement Agreement. </P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:12pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times 
New Roman" ALIGN="justify">The Arrangement is subject to the approval of the 
TSX. Since the Arrangement will result in the issuance of greater than 25% of 
the currently
outstanding Denison Shares, the rules of the TSX require that Denison obtain 
approval for the issuance of Denison Shares pursuant to the Arrangement from the
holders of a majority of Denison Shares present in person or represented by 
proxy at a duly
constituted shareholders meeting. The TSX conditionally approved the listing of 
the Denison Shares issuable pursuant to the Arrangement on September&nbsp;4, 
2015, subject to Shareholder approval. </P>
 <p STYLE="margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt ; font-size:8pt">&nbsp;</P> <P 
STYLE="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New 
Roman" ALIGN="center">iv </P>
<p Style='page-break-before:always'>
<HR  SIZE="3" style="COLOR:#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">
<P STYLE="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times 
New Roman"><B>Q: How will I know when the Arrangement will be implemented? 
</B></P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:12pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times 
New Roman" ALIGN="justify">A: The Effective Date will occur upon satisfaction or
waiver of all of the conditions to the completion of the Arrangement. On the 
Effective
Date, Denison will publicly announce that the conditions are satisfied or waived
and that the Arrangement has been implemented. </P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12pt; 
margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman" 
ALIGN="justify">If the
Consolidation Resolution is approved by Shareholders, it is currently the 
intention of the parties to the Arrangement Agreement that the Consolidation 
will be effected on the Effective Date, immediately after the Arrangement. The 
Consolidation will
be deemed effective immediately upon filing Articles of Amendment and the New 
Denison Shares will be posted for trading on the TSX and the NYSE MKT shortly 
after the Effective Date. </P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:12pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times 
New Roman"><B>Q: Are there risks I should consider in deciding whether to vote 
for the Arrangement? </B></P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:12pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times 
New Roman" ALIGN="justify">A: Yes. Shareholders should carefully consider the 
risk factors relating to the Arrangement and following the completion of the 
Arrangement.
Some of these risks include, but are not limited to the following: (i)&nbsp;the 
Arrangement may be terminated in certain circumstances, including in the event 
of a Material Adverse Effect, (ii)&nbsp;there can be no certainty that all 
conditions
precedent to the Arrangement Agreement will be satisfied, (iii)&nbsp;the 
Arrangement may not be completed; (iv)&nbsp;there are uncertainties associated 
with integrating operations and realizing the anticipated benefits of the 
Arrangement;
(v)&nbsp;there are risks associated with the change in management relationships,
(vi)&nbsp;there are risks associated with the Exchange Ratio of Denison Shares 
being offered to Fission shareholders; (vii)&nbsp;Denison will incur costs even 
if the
Arrangement is not completed and may have to pay a Termination Payment and/or
Termination Expense Reimbursement; (viii)&nbsp;Denison directors and executive 
officers may have interests in the Arrangement that are different from those of 
the
Shareholders; and (ix)&nbsp;risks associated with the Retention Bonus Payments 
and loss of key management personnel. </P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12pt; margin-
bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman" ALIGN="justify">See 
&#147;The
Arrangement &#150; Risk Factors of the Arrangement&#148; and &#147;The 
Arrangement &#150; Risk Factor Following Completion of the Arrangement&#148; in 
this Circular&#148;. </P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:12pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times 
New Roman"><B>Q: Am I entitled to Dissent Rights? </B></P> <P STYLE="margin-
top:12pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman" 
ALIGN="justify">A:
Holders of Denison Shares do not have any Dissent Rights in connection with any 
of the Denison Resolutions to be considered at the Meeting. </P> <P 
STYLE="margin-top:12pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New
Roman"><B>Q: What
will happen to the Denison Shares that I currently own after completion of the 
Arrangement? </B></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-
size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman" ALIGN="justify">A: If the Arrangement 
and the
Consolidation are completed, Shareholders will be entitled to receive one 
(1)&nbsp;New Denison Share (being a post-Consolidation Denison Share) for each 
two (2)&nbsp;Denison Shares owned prior to the Consolidation. No fractional 
shares will be
issued as a result of the Consolidation, and any fraction will be rounded down 
to the nearest whole number, without payment or compensation in lieu thereof. 
</P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:12pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times 
New Roman"><B>Q: Should Registered Shareholders send in their Letter of 
Transmittal and Denison Share Certificates now? </B></P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:12pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times 
New Roman" ALIGN="justify">A: Yes. If you are a Registered Shareholder, we 
encourage you to complete, sign, date and return the enclosed Letter of 
Transmittal, together
with your Denison Share certificate(s), as soon as possible as this will assist 
in arranging for the prompt exchange of your Denison Shares if the Consolidation
is completed. If the Arrangement is not completed, the Consolidation will not be
completed and your Denison Share certificates will be returned to you. </P> <P 
STYLE="margin-top:12pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New
Roman"><B>Q: Do Non-Registered Shareholders need to submit a Letter of 
Transmittal?
</B></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-
family:Times New Roman" ALIGN="justify">A: No. If you hold your Denison Shares 
through a broker or other intermediary you are a Non-Registered Shareholder and 
you are not
required to submit a Letter of Transmittal. Instead, please contact your broker 
or other intermediary for instructions and assistance in receiving your New 
Denison Shares. </P>
 <p STYLE="margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt ; font-size:8pt">&nbsp;</P> <P 
STYLE="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New 
Roman" ALIGN="center">v </P>
<p Style='page-break-before:always'>
<HR  SIZE="3" style="COLOR:#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">
<P STYLE="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times 
New Roman"><B>Q: Who can I contact if I have questions regarding voting my 
Denison Shares? </B></P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:12pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times 
New Roman" ALIGN="justify">A: Denison has retained the services of Boudicca 
Proxy Consultants to solicit proxies and assist Shareholders with voting
procedures. You can
contact Boudicca Proxy Consultants if you have any questions in the following 
ways: </P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-
family:Times New Roman">Toll Free (in North America): 1-800-837-3821 </P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times 
New Roman">Outside North America: 416-900-1263 or +44 (0)203 475 3414 </P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times 
New Roman">Email: <U>denisonmines@boudiccaproxy.com</U> </P> <P STYLE="margin-
top:12pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New 
Roman">Shareholders may
also contact Computershare by telephone at 1-800-564-6253 or by email to 
<U>service@computershare.com</U>. </P>
 <p STYLE="margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt ; font-size:8pt">&nbsp;</P> <P 
STYLE="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New 
Roman" ALIGN="center">vi </P>
<p Style='page-break-before:always'>
<HR  SIZE="3" style="COLOR:#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">
<P STYLE="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times 
New Roman" ALIGN="center"><B>NOTICE OF SPECIAL MEETING OF SHAREHOLDERS </B></P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times 
New Roman" ALIGN="center"><B>OF DENISON MINES CORP. </B></P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:12pt; margin-bottom:0pt; text-indent:4%; font-size:10pt; 
font-family:Times New Roman" ALIGN="justify">NOTICE IS HEREBY GIVEN that a 
special meeting (the &#147;<B>Meeting</B>&#148;) of the shareholders (the
&#147;<B>Shareholders</B>&#148;) of Denison Mines Corp. 
(&#147;<B>Denison</B>&#148;) will be held at the offices of Cassels 
Brock&nbsp;&amp; Blackwell LLP, 40 King Street West, Suite 2100, Toronto, 
Ontario, on October&nbsp;14, 2015 at 10:00 a.m.
(Toronto time) for the following purposes, as more particularly described in the
accompanying management information circular (the &#147;<B>Circular</B>&#148;): 
</P> <P STYLE="font-size:6pt;margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt">&nbsp;</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; font-family:Times New Roman; font-
size:10pt" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="4%" VALIGN="top" ALIGN="left">1.</TD>
<TD ALIGN="left" VALIGN="top"> <P ALIGN="justify" STYLE="font-family:Times New 
Roman; font-size:10pt">to consider and if thought fit, approve with or without 
variation, an ordinary resolution authorizing and approving the issuance of such
number of
common shares in the capital of Denison (the &#147;<B>Denison Shares</B>&#148;) 
as is necessary to allow Denison to acquire 100% of Fission Uranium Corp. 
(&#147;<B>Fission</B>&#148;) on the basis of 1.26 Denison Shares on a pre-
consolidation basis
(approximately 0.63 Denison Shares on a post-consolidation basis) for each 
common share of Fission (a &#147;<B>Fission Share</B>&#148;), including Denison 
Shares issuable upon exercise of stock options or warrants granted by Fission to
purchase
Fission Shares, all pursuant to the Arrangement involving Denison and Fission 
(the &#147;<B>Share Issuance Resolution</B>&#148;); provided that the maximum 
number of Denison Shares to be issued to acquire the outstanding Fission Shares 
shall not be
greater than the number of Denison Shares issued and outstanding immediately 
prior to the completion of the Arrangement, less 100,000 (the 
&#147;<B>Consideration Share Maximum</B>&#148;), and in such case the exchange 
ratio shall be adjusted
accordingly; </P></TD></TR></TABLE> <P STYLE="font-size:6pt;margin-
top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt">&nbsp;</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; font-family:Times New Roman; font-
size:10pt" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="4%" VALIGN="top" ALIGN="left">2.</TD>
<TD ALIGN="left" VALIGN="top"> <P ALIGN="justify" STYLE="font-family:Times New 
Roman; font-size:10pt">to consider and if thought fit, approve with or without 
variation, a special resolution authorizing and approving an amendment to the 
Denison
Articles to effect a consolidation (the &#147;<B>Consolidation</B>&#148;) of the
issued and outstanding Denison Shares on a 2-for-1 basis (the 
&#147;<B>Consolidation Resolution</B>&#148;); </P></TD></TR></TABLE>
<P STYLE="font-size:6pt;margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt">&nbsp;</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; font-family:Times New Roman; font-
size:10pt" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="4%" VALIGN="top" ALIGN="left">3.</TD>
<TD ALIGN="left" VALIGN="top"> <P ALIGN="justify" STYLE="font-family:Times New 
Roman; font-size:10pt">to consider and if thought fit, approve with or without 
variation, a special resolution authorizing and approving an amendment to the 
Denison
Articles to effect the name change of Denison to &#147;Denison Energy 
Corp.&#148; or such other name as is determined by the Board in its sole 
discretion, subject to regulatory approval (the &#147;<B>Name Change 
Resolution</B>&#148;);
</P></TD></TR></TABLE> <P STYLE="font-size:6pt;margin-top:0pt;margin-
bottom:0pt">&nbsp;</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; font-family:Times New Roman; font-
size:10pt" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="4%" VALIGN="top" ALIGN="left">4.</TD>
<TD ALIGN="left" VALIGN="top"> <P ALIGN="justify" STYLE="font-family:Times New 
Roman; font-size:10pt">to consider and if thought fit, approve with or without 
variation, an ordinary resolution authorizing and approving the issuance of that
number of
Denison Shares as is necessary to make the retention bonus payments to each of 
Messrs Randhawa, McElroy, Hochstein, Cates (at the election of Mr.&nbsp;Cates), 
Charlish (at the election of Mr.&nbsp;Charlish) and other employees of Denison 
(allocated
at the discretion of Denison), which Denison Shares will be valued at the five 
(5)&nbsp;day volume weighted average price of the Denison Shares on the Toronto 
Stock Exchange (on a post-consolidation basis) immediately following the date on
which the
Arrangement becomes effective (the &#147;<B>Retention Bonus 
Resolution</B>&#148;); and </P></TD></TR></TABLE> <P STYLE="font-
size:6pt;margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt">&nbsp;</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; font-family:Times New Roman; font-
size:10pt" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="4%" VALIGN="top" ALIGN="left">5.</TD>
<TD ALIGN="left" VALIGN="top"> <P ALIGN="justify" STYLE="font-family:Times New 
Roman; font-size:10pt">to transact such other business as may properly come 
before the Meeting or any adjournment or postponement thereof. 
</P></TD></TR></TABLE>
<P STYLE="margin-top:12pt; margin-bottom:0pt; text-indent:4%; font-size:10pt; 
font-family:Times New Roman" ALIGN="justify">The Arrangement will be completed 
pursuant to the Arrangement Agreement and Plan of Arrangement dated as of 
July&nbsp;27,
2015, between Denison, 9372721 Canada Inc. (a wholly-owned subsidiary of 
Denison) and Fission, a copy of which is available on SEDAR at 
<U>www.sedar.com</U> under Denison&#146;s profile. A description of the 
Arrangement and the other matters to be
dealt with at the Meeting is included in the accompanying Circular. </P> <P 
STYLE="margin-top:12pt; margin-bottom:0pt; text-indent:4%; font-size:10pt; font-
family:Times New Roman" ALIGN="justify">Only Shareholders of record at the close
of business
on September&nbsp;4, 2015 (the<B> &#147;Record Date</B>&#148;) are entitled to 
receive notice of the Meeting and any adjournment or postponement thereof. </P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:12pt; margin-bottom:0pt; text-indent:4%; font-size:10pt;
font-family:Times New Roman" ALIGN="justify"><B>Shareholders who are unable to 
be present in person at the Meeting are requested to complete, date, sign and 
return, in the
envelope provided for that purpose, the enclosed form of proxy. In order to be 
voted, proxies must be received by Computershare Investor Services Inc. by no 
later than 10:00 a.m. (Toronto time) on October&nbsp;9, 2015 or, in the case of 
any
adjournment or postponement of the Meeting, by no later than 48 hours (excluding
Saturdays, Sundays and holidays) before the time for the adjourned or postponed 
Meeting. The Chairman of the Meeting may waive the proxy cut-off time at his 
discretion
without notice. </B></P>
 <p STYLE="margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt ; font-size:8pt">&nbsp;</P> <P 
STYLE="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New 
Roman" ALIGN="center">vii </P>
<p Style='page-break-before:always'>
<HR  SIZE="3" style="COLOR:#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">
<P STYLE="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times 
New Roman">DATED September&nbsp;15, 2015. </P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:12pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times 
New Roman"><B>BY ORDER OF THE BOARD </B></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12pt; margin-
bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman"><I></I>(signed) 
<I>&#147;Ron F.
Hochstein&#148; </I></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-
size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman">Ron F. Hochstein </P> <P STYLE="margin-
top:0pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New 
Roman">Executive Chairman
</P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-
family:Times New Roman">Denison Mines Corp. </P>

STYLE="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New

<TD VALIGN="bottom" ALIGN="right">48</TD>
<TD NOWRAP VALIGN="bottom">&nbsp;&nbsp;</TD></TR>
